p: In 2001, Imanaka used the substitution strategy to improve the ionic conductivity of MZP by partially replacing Zr 4+ with Nb 5+ (Imanaka et al., 2000b). The substitution was used to statistically distribute mobile Mg ions to make a smooth Mg ion diffusion but it also reduced the number of migrating Mg 2+ ion species in the solid solution electrolyte. Thus, the optimum conductivity was observed at x = 0.15 in Mg 1−2x(Zr 1−xNb x) 4P 6O 24 with 7.7 × 10 −4 S cm −1 at 600°C and 3.7 × 10 −3 S cm −1 at 750°C, demonstrating little enhancement compared to pristine MZP.
